snippet: Although global demand for solar panels and wind turbines has grown rapidly in recent years, China’s manufacturing capacity grew faster, creating an oversupply and a price war, Keith Bradsher reported for The New York Times.
abstract: Although global demand for solar panels and wind turbines has grown rapidly in recent years, China’s manufacturing capacity grew faster, creating an oversupply and a price war, Keith Bradsher reported for The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Although global demand for solar panels and wind turbines has grown rapidly in recent years, China’s manufacturing capacity grew faster, creating an oversupply and a price war, Keith Bradsher reported for The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Glut of Solar Panels Poses a New Threat to China
